comment: SCOTUS did not rule gerrymandering is constitutional . They ruled that without a way to determine a gerrymander , any ruling they make on it seems partisan . They left the matter to the state courts which have ruled that some plans and districts are unfair and must be redrawn .

            :polarity -
            :ARG0 (g / government-organization
